title: 108_hr3636
content: The Act is titled the "Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003" and includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act, specifically prohibiting health discrimination in the group market based on genetic information. This includes no enrollment restrictions for genetic services and no discrimination in premiums based on predictive genetic information. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits premium discrimination against groups in the group market based on predictive genetic information. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits adjusting premium or contribution amounts for a group health plan based on predictive genetic information. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits adjusting premium or contribution amounts for a group health plan based on predictive genetic information. Definitions in the Public Health Service Act include "family member" as spouse, dependent child, or blood relative, and "genetic services" as health services for interpreting predictive genetic information. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits using predictive genetic information to adjust group health plan premiums. Predictive genetic information identifies gene variations linked to diseases or increased disease risk. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits using predictive genetic information to adjust group health plan premiums. Predictive genetic information refers to the risk of developing a disease or having offspring with a disease, but without showing signs for diagnosis. Individual identifiers are removed to prevent disclosure of the individual's information. Predictive genetic information refers to the risk of developing a disease or having offspring with a disease, without showing signs for diagnosis. Information is protected to prevent disclosure of the individual's identity. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits using predictive genetic information for adjusting group health plan premiums in the individual market. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits health discrimination based on predictive genetic information. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits health insurance issuers from using predictive genetic information for eligibility or setting premium rates in the individual market. The Genetic Privacy and Nondiscrimination Act of 2003 prohibits health insurance issuers from using predictive genetic information for eligibility or setting premium rates in the individual market. This Act applies to group health plans and health insurance coverage for plan years beginning after 1 year from the date of enactment, as well as health insurance coverage in the individual market after 1 year from the date of enactment.
